body:
Hi Bhartendu,
Check the following article.


*   CM Kwok and

*   TM Chung

Computer simulation study of a horizontal light pipe integrated with laser cut panels in a dense urban environmentLighting Research and Technology December 2008 40: 287-305, doi:10.1177/1477153508094584

Regards

Veronica

Veronica Garcia Hansen
B Arch PhD
Senior Lecturer in Architecture- School of Design. Faculty of Creative Industries
Researcher  QUT Lighting Group
Research associate Centre for Subtropical Design
Queensland University of Technology
Email: v.garciahansen at qut.edu.au<mailto:v.garciahansen at qut.edu.au> | Phone: +61 7 31381623

Reply-To: Radiance general discussion <radiance-general at radiance-online.org<mailto:radiance-general at radiance-online.org>>
To: <radiance-general at radiance-online.org<mailto:radiance-general at radiance-online.org>>
Dear All,

Waiting for your response.

Regards,
Bhartendu Awasthi

Sent: Friday, November 14, 2014 3:39 PM
To: 'radiance-general at radiance-online.org<mailto:'radiance-general at radiance-online.org>'
Dear All,

I am new to Radiance and trying to show the effect of light  pipes in daylight levels with ECOTECT and Radiance. I have created the building in ECOTECT but unable to model the light pipes exactly. Is there any reference document for the same? Or if anyone can guide me in detail how to model the same?
Any help will be appreciated.

Many Thanks,
Bhartendu Awasthi
